reviews.text: Very handy for the railway station; no more than ten minutes walk to the Old Town Square and a very comfortable bed. However a shambolic check-in process, no air con and a TV that turned itself on at 5:25 in the morning weren't expected as part of the 5 star experience. Nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Hits & Misses

reviews.text: Oh, it was such a promising set of dates! A five-star Italian beauty “slumming” in Prague in my price range. But, oh, what a beating my heart took!
reviews.title: An affordable, elegant, hotel with serious service lapses

reviews.text: (She loves me) A beautiful former bank building, redesigned into an elegantly appointed hotel, particularly for the price.
reviews.title: Different and unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (She loves me not) The air conditioning failed to work more often than it worked. Fortunately, we (my new college-graduated daughter and I) were able to open the vestigial patio door a wee bit to get some fresh air, but sleeping was quite uncomfortable. Yes, I could have had someone come up to fix it in the middle of the night, but it was an, umm, “cozy” room, and the bathrobe would not quite gird my girth (see below). I did call to ask if I understood how to sit the thermostat correctly, but demurred at the offering of a service call. Someone might have asked us the next day if there was still a problem with the air conditioning. Someone did not.
reviews.title: 5star luxury that doesn't cost the world - you will feel like a celebrity!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (She loves me) Breakfast was delicious, varied, and ample, and promised at check-in to be free to me as a member of Marriott's Gold Rewards program.
reviews.title: Elegant Old World Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall: Elegant. Very suiting for the Praha old town area. As other reviewers have noted the lobby used to be a bank complete with a large vault that has been converted into a very nice cocktail trying/study room. Rather than the traditional counter, the check in process and guest business is conducted by agents siting behind tables while you sit in a facing chair in the open lobby space . It's different and a notable change but can be confusing for first time guests.
reviews.title: But not perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar/morning breakfast area is beautiful and upholds the hotel's lofty elegance.
reviews.title: LOVED the Boscolo!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our (upgraded) room was nice but not large. It did have nice touches and was well appointed in its details but it left me wondering what a standard room would have been like. Speaking of the room getting there was...different. After leaving the elevator and walking down a hallway following the posted room numbered signs we had to actually walk down and then up two small flights of stairs that led us to another side of the building and hallway for our room. Good thing I was traveling light that day.
reviews.title: Perfect summer weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apparently this hotel joined the Marriott network. Which led us to give it a try. Considering it's beauty and luxuriousness the hotel does offer reasonable rates. This Prague old town hotel is beautiful and offers some world class touches and appointments that it inherited from the stature of an elegant bank that surely catered to the wealthy in its day. And it's that type of clientele, which would not settle for less than a $400-$600 per night (or more) stay that will find this hotel as a "comfortable yet typical" value for their money and expectations. I am certain this hotel will satisfy that type of customer well.
reviews.title: Great location, amazing pool and best breakfast ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But if you are a Marriott rewards or Honors driven traveler looking in the Old town Prague area I believe you can find more satisfying options.
reviews.title: Location, staff, facilities all top class... price was even better!

reviews.text: Beautiful place to stay, lovely rooms and communal areas. Food was terrific, as we're the spa facilities (despite the building works). It was a great location, near to the old city. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Splendid!

reviews.text: I chose the Boscolo Prague because the hotel was listed as a Marriott property. I chose the Boscolo because the room rate was considerably less than the Prague Marriott Hotel. Also, the hotel photos showed the Boscolo to have an old world European look which I thought was charming. The room we were shown to was fine, had all the amenities of a good hotel BUT the room looked out on a massive white wall which they tried to camouflage by installing a plexiglas screen with green leaves painted on it. I was terribly disappointed by the horrid view..here I was in beautiful Prague and I looked out my hotel window at white roofing. I could barely see the sky. I was so disappointed in the room view that we decided to upgrade our accomodation. This upgrade resulted in adding 40 Eur to our room charge. The hotel staff was very understanding and helpful in relocating us. My recommendation is that if you choose the Boscolo do not choose the lowest price room unless you are fine with a really bad view. I repeat, the room was quiet nice. The location of the hotel was not the best. Our travel companions stayed at the Old Town Hilton. The location of that hotel was far better than the Boscolo. We walked the few blocks from the Boscolo to the Hilton (which is directly across the street from the Prague Marriott Hotel) a couple times a day. I felt as if I were walking into a step down in neighborhood as I headed to the Boscolo from the Hilton location. We encountered a problem with the water to the bathtub. When I ran a bath the water was yellow/rust color. I reported the problem immediately and was promised repair. The problem was never fixed and persisted throughout our three day stay. When I complained about the water problem upon check out we were given a small reduction on our room rate. The lesson to be learned here is you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: It wasn't really a Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is beautiful. The suite is very spacious with all th amenities one needs to feel like royalty in this gorgeous, historic town. The vintage headboard and double panes windows mixes with modern art throughout the property to create a unique blend much like the diverse city of Prague itself. The breakfast is beautiful and tasty, not sure why other reviewers are complaining! This is definitely 5 star and worth the experience. We enjoyed being close to all the sites, the tram locations and the train station so we could head out on our next journey to Berlin! We will definitely be back soon to the Boscolo for another magical trip to this glorious city!
reviews.title: Majestic Prague hotel fit for a queen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 3 nights and it was the best hotel of our 2-week vacation, probably the most expensive too though. The hotel is conveniently located, at walking distance from the train station, the airport shuttle bus stop, and also from the old town. The hotel itself is beautiful. The staff was very professional and welcoming. The breakfast buffet had anything you can dream of...except a reasonable price. We didn't have time to use the pool but we went to take a look at it and it seemed great.
reviews.title: Just perfect!
Eh, keep looking...
reviews.text: If we could give this hotel a 3.5, we would. We left the Boscolo Prague with mixed feelings. First, we used Marriott Rewards points for our stay - figured it would be worth it based on reviews. On the flip side, I don't think it was worth trading in our points. A newly minted Marriott hotel, it's got the name - but not the full package. You are most certainly wowed when you walk into the lobby, but there are some rough spots around the edges here and there. The room was just okay, needs some updates. Internet (wifi) was iffy at best and non-existent at worst in the rooms. Breakfast was included with our stay, but the 25€ per person price tag if it hadn't of been included was not worth it. Go get something from a cafe for 2€.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and couldn't believe the standard of the accomodation and friendliness of the helpful staff. An excellent place to be in very close proximity to the rail station (5 minutes walk) and so close to the city centre. The reception hall is beautiful and welcoming, everywhere is spotless and the swimming pools and sauna are certainly worth a visit, we swam every evening and the pool was never overcrowded. Only downside was the breakfast was expensive and certainly not value for money, otherwise a visit worthwhile and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay here. i booked at bookings.com and got a really good price for a weekend away for B&B.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay in a top-class hotel
Excellent service!
reviews.text: We ate at the hotel one night in the restaurant and it was also good, although it was nice to eat out elsewhere for most of our meals. We had a double massage in the spa and it was brilliant! The swimming pool and spa facilities were gorgoeous, clean and the perfect way to heat-up after a chlly day sight-seeing. Hopefully I'll beback!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on June 11th to this hotel and was trying to go up the stairs with our luggage. The gentleman ran out to help us and carried our luggage and hosted us until the concierge checked us in. When we told here were on our honeymoon he treated us with 2 glasses of champagne. After he hand us his card and offer his personal assistance if we ever need anything during out stay.what was so amazing is that he was the general manager of this 5starhotel! very impressive!!!
reviews.title: Vera Nice hotel,pricy bkfastd

reviews.text: Very nice hotel,very close to old town,train station ,opera etc.walking distance to all mayor attractions.service was very good and maid service excellent.The only cons against this hotel is the pricy breakfast 25 euros pp and the business center has only one computer and very slow Internet. No free wifi even in lobby or other public areas,and Internet was also pricy.otherwise I will stay in this hotel again and recommend it to friends
reviews.title: Great service & amenities
